did.abstract: Maps created for the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Roy Worden, of Jackson, Michigan, in 1966 (Donor No. 4376), Judge and Mrs. John W. Fitzgerald, of Grand Ledge, Michigan, in 1967 (Donor No. 4510), and Jacqueline Lewis, of Ann Arbor, Michigan, in 1981 (Donor No. 6677).

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., Elope. Mapping Section. [Maps of Archangel District, Russia], 1918, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

scopecontent.p: The collection contains maps (Scale 1:420,000 and [1:1,050,000] not "1/105,000") of the district of Archangel, Russia created in 1918 by engineers of the Allied intervention in North Russia. Individual sheets are by the Elope Mapping Section or the N.R.E.F. Mapping Section.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: North Russia Expeditionary Force. Mapping Section.
